page.title: 01Bearley
page.content: Bearley is situated some 4 1/2 miles NNW of Stratford Upon Avon on the A34. The village is mentioned in the original Domesday book but has always been small. It probably began as a result of a clearing in the Forest of Avon on the rock of a saltway. The population in 1881 was 215 but this grew after the end of the second world war when RAF camps in the village were invaded by squatters. A council estate was built to house the people and there are now some two hundred houses in the village. More houses are being built. The village is set in rich farmland although now provides a living for very few of the inhabitants. Bearley is made up of three district area each represented by its own type of housig. The old village consist of 50 or so mostly seventeenth century cottages
